newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norsk Hydro sees H2 profits hit by weak aluminium.
newsitem.headline: Norsk Hydro sees H2 profits hit by weak aluminium.

text.p: Norsk Hydro ASA said on Monday earnings in the third and fourth quarter were expected to be adversely impacted compared with the same year-ago periods by recent falls in aluminium prices.
Hydro said the three month price for aluminium on the London Metals Exchange had averaged slightly under $1,500 per tonne in the third quarter of 1996 compared with $1,861 in the same period 1995.
"The current low prices are expected to adversely affect earnings in the third and fourth quarters of 1996 compared with the corresponding periods in 1995," Hydro said.
The company made the statement in connection to an announcement of a new issue of 20-year debentures to the aggregate amount of $250 million.
